Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful views from top floor rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Allison M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located conveniently in a quieter area of Barcelona, without being far out. The rooms are modern and clean, and the staff was friendly. The breakfast was delicious with lots of warm choices in addition to the spread of cold cereals, fruits, cheeses, and meats. For a treat, try to get one of the 2 rooms on the top floor. You may have to walk your luggage up the last flight of stairs, but the JETTED TUB, huge terrace and fantastic view of Barcelona is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location an quite a bit of traffic”
Reviews.Author: Withopeneye
Reviews.Content: Hotel overall fairly nice. Average rooms and service. Good and cheap breakfast for 10 Euros. Free WiFi. Got the room for 90 Euros for one night. Overall good value. Mutaner Street has tons of traffic. Noise level fairly high. Not good if you seek a quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very very bad customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Berth D
Reviews.Content: Apart from the fact that should not have been consindered as a 4 star, but rather a 3 star hotel, there are some other points I would like to refer to, based on my recent unpleasant visit to this hotel. The only reason for writing this review is that I believe this hotel is an insult towards customers and travellers. Our stay's duration was 7 days and as the days were passing the things did not get any better, on the contrary became even worse. To begin with, our room did not have any internet access and thus I had all the time to move to the reception in order to check my business emails. In addition, the sheets were not extremely white-clean and room service did not visited the room for a couple of days without any reason. Furthermore, the sound isolation was really bad. Moreover the toilet rubbish bin was broken from the beginning and althouth reported several times never got replaced. The response time of the reception was extremely slow and the staff generally speaking was quite rude. Last but not least, the worst thing that happened was this one time that the room service did not visited the room and the toilet paper run out, after my request and delay of 30 minutes and a second call to the reception, one of the staff opened the door and entered without even knocking! Because I would not like to refer to only negative issues, althouth these seem to remain in memory, the hotel had rich breakfast, really spacious bathroom, reasonable pricing, it is near the centre of the city, but apart from these nothing special. Based on my personal experience, I would NOT recommended it under no circumstances!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Hardiman_11
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay on the Ramblas to be near the centre of the city knowing that it had Gaudis work there and to basically have lots of Sangria and see the Sagrada { unfinished cathedral.} My agent didnt tell me that we were going to this" out of town" horrible hotel . I found out when the taxi drove us there after our 4mths of travel. We were short of money but not worried because breakfast was included and we had paid for a city tour before we left home. Now we are very fit walkers but we are oldies and the hilly walk to the Ramblas and Guell Park in 38 degrees nearly killed us. Our city tour didnt turn up and we waited for 2 mornings. The receptionist didnt want to help . It was though she didnt like Australians. When it was time to leave they wouldnt give us a late checkout and we werent going to fly out till 6pm a long trip Barcelona-London- sydney. As it was so hot i went into the toilets to wash myself before the trip home and the receptionist followed me in. I dont normally be critical of staff because they are a plentiful commodity and they move on but this experience ruined our only visit to Barcelona. We had a view of rooftops and the bathroom was narrow. I wouldnt advise people to go here unless you love a long walk to see something worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Barcelona trip”
Reviews.Author: Reviewyoureview
Reviews.Content: For the first time, me and my family (the father, mother, two teens, and one kid) went to Europe. It was an excellent trip, we decided to go to Barcelona and got an excellent deal for this hotel as "Catalonia Suite Hotel", but apparently, it's name has changed recently to "Catalonia Barcelona 505". The reception were nice and talked very good English, the rooms were very big and clean, breakfast wasn't Catalan or Spanish, but international, fresh and yummy, and the metro station was a five minute walk. The hotel is really good and it's near a super market which we bough bread and cheese from it and made sandwiches for dinner. We took the Barcelona Bus Turistic ( http://www.barcelonabusturistic.cat ) and it was a very good decision, we walked about 20 min.s to the nearest tourist bus station and went to see the best of Barcelona including Sagrada Familia, Montjuic area, Tibidabo, and the Barcelonetta area while we took the metro to Placa Espanya at night (magic fountain show) and Placa Catalunya and we walked about an hour to Parc Guell. I really enjoyed my trip and sleep quality was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Average 4*hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scandic77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked through KavalieroViajes travel agency. It was an average 4* hotel with spacious rooms, clean enough. Comfortable beds and pillows. Stayed in a room on 7th floor (max 8) noise level from the street is kept low through the double glazing. The room has air conditioning mini fridge and TV. The bathroom also spacious but smelly due to lack of good ventilation. Breakfast average continental but plenty. 5minutes walk to underground metro stop, 10 minutes away from plaza Catalunya (start of LaRamplas). Tips. Buy the T10 ticket to use in Metro and Bus ( u can use it numerous times within 1 hour, costs 8.25E) The tourist bus is also an economic solution costs 20E for 1 day or 25E for two days. It will take you everywhere. If you're planning to visit all the museums buy the museum card costs 25E and allows you to enter several museums including Picasso and La Pedrera in different case expect to pay around 10E and 14E for each, as u can see just the entrance to these two costs around 25E, so buying this museum pass is a good value for money. Entance to Miro museum costs 8E while Dali museum in Figueres 9E p/p Expect to wait in ques at least 15min in all main atractions (Casa Batlo-La Pedrera-Picasso) while at SagradaFamilia it will take ages waiting in line. Better stay out and take photos the exterior. Make sure you see the water fountains show at Plaza Espanya (the show I believe starts 9.30 to 10.30 Thursday and Friday) Take care of your belongings at all time. Communication with the locals is difficult (use hand language and gestures). When ordering food also check the drinks prices. Food may cost 12E p/p but a jar of sangria 19E (serves 4), large glass of draught beer 15E, 4 pieces of bread 8E its a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID - AVOID - AVOIDHostages in a hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sakiscyp26
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I am held as a hostage in a hotel. We were there as a football team participating in Barcelona Cup and I am one of the coaches. We stayed there 7 days. On the 4th day a wardrobe door fell from the wardrobe (a sliding piece of glass with a frame is the door) and hit one of the kids on the head. Thank god the boy was not hurt badly. The door ,as it was only glass, was teared into pieces. The bellboy came to the room after we were notified and we noticed that the wheel on the bottom of the door was faulty so as the door slided it went off the rail and fell down. The bellboy then apologised and gave instructions to the reception to change the room, something that didn't happen as the hotel was fully booked. The boys parents wanted to sue the hotel after this incident, but since they apologised we convinced them not to proceed. On our check out day (after three days) we asked for a room for our luggage and were given one ,as we had to check out at 11 o clock but the bus would come on 4 o clock in the afternoon. At 3 o clock the " joke of a manager" of the hotel came with an invoice of €215 as the cost for the broken door and demanded to pay!!! For three days we were told nothing, and one hour before leaving the hotel with our luggages locked in a room we had to pay to go!!! After we refused to pay, as we explained the situation and that the hotel should apologise and that somebody could have been hurt badly from this incident, the "joke of a manager" of the hotel insisted that the door was broken from the boys. Actually the boys that was hurt parents got furious and the "joke of a manager" called the police who arrived without uniforms (4 of them) but with guns on their waist. In some stage the "joke of a manager" asked us to pay half the price to end the argumet (how cheap can this be as he insisted that the cost was €215). When the police arrived they were just looking and not intervening, and then we asked them if they were the police and if they were on duty. They replied yes to both questions. Then we asked them why they were there and replied that they came for coffee!!! Therefore we told them that the "joke of a manager" would not give us our luggage to go and we were held hostages and asked them to take action. One of them showed his gun and told us "pay". The bus was already waiting for 20 minutes and we could lose our flight. 64 people left on the decision of the so-called manager and the so-called police if they were to leave us go to the airport. The most ridiculous part of the story is that we had 34 rooms booked for 7 nights and the least a chain of hotels like Catalonia Hotels is to be able to cover a minor damage even if it was made from the guests which in our case was a faulty door with a danger of a really bad accident. What happened then is that we paid the €215 because we would lose the flight. We reported the incident in the police at the airport and will proceed with legal actions from our country against this "joke of a manager" and the "joke of policemen" whom we have their faces in camera and also Catalonia Hotels. Also we will report the " joke of a manager" to the higher hierarchy of the Catalonia Hotels Chain as he is a disgrace to their brand. Now apart from the above incident. -Location far away from centre -Bar without bartender most of the time and some times they wouldn't have change and therefore would not give any drinks unless you didn't want change. -Restaurant service a total disaster. Could wait for more than 20 minutes to replenish dishes in buffet and also plates. The same with breakfast as to replenish cheese or ham could take ages. Food though was tasty. -Reception friendly and helpfull and could speak english. -Manager a total joke!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for students”
Reviews.Author: Nikole2011
Reviews.Content: This is our last night here as apart of eftours and ii must say it's great. Breakfast and dinner are delectable. Thee staff is friendly and bilingual. There is wifi in every room, and thee trip to thee metro is 5 minutes and yhu can easily be in thee town centre....

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: fidiUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of a large chain that has hotels all over Barcelona. This one's in a middle-class suburb, you can reach the centre by a bus or metro (allow 30 minutes). We were in no rush and quite liked seeing everyday life, and there's some nice cafes for breakfast nearby. The hotel itself is not 4 star by UK standards- on our first night we were put in a room with a blocked sink and it really smelled, we complained in the morning and were told they would fix it but when we returned in the afternoon and spoke to the (different) shift manager there was no note about about it, but he was very apologetic and moved us to another room immediately. We also got a 6am wake up call for a group from Australia we had nothing to do with. The hotel was full of groups, and I would say it's more suitable for group tours than for couples. Apart from these little let-downs, I would say it's good value for money if you don't mind staying a bit out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Abbeykeating
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, would consider more an irish 3star, but for a city visit was great, staff lovely , porters friendly, rooms very clean, didnt eat there so dont know. The distance to city centre was 10mins on bus approx depending on traffic, Bus stop outside the door, Bus service brilliant. Quiet at night , nice bar next door , good cafes for breakfast very near and supermarket close too. Overall great location and was much cheaper than city centre, If travelling from airport on coach, the no 58 takes you from very close to aircoach stop to very close to hotel. On your return to airport make sure you get correct bus going to your TERMINAL. there are 2 Over all had a brill time and would send friends to same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quiet location, perfect, will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle_Leanne
Reviews.Content: I've really enjoyed my stay at the hotel. I was in Barcelona for a vacation, and this hotel was perfect. The room is very big, and very clean. The staff is very kind and willing to help. As I arrived very early in the morning, they've immediately offered to have my room ready several hours before the official check-in, and indeed, it was ready by 11. The room was very clean, spacious, great wi-fi connection. There's a mini-bar, but I didn't use it. As to location - the hotel is not in the loud centre of town, but you can easily walk (lovely sights) or take a 10 mins ride on Metro (El Putxet station is just minutes away). Perfect if you want to party and return to a quiet area to sleep. Breakfast was nice, though admittedly I'm not much of a breakfast person and am happy with pretty much anything. Bottom line: a very nice, clean hotel in a resedential (but very lively area, full of coffeshops and restaurants!) area, perfect for a good night sleep. Great, huge rooms and bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel, great service, will be back again for sure”
Reviews.Author: Omer72
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the stuff was really helpful, we had a room with a jacuzzi, very big, extra bad for the kid. breakfast was very good, we ate every morning and took some fruits. The metro is 5 min walk and 5 stops from the center. The only thing is that the last metro is at around midnight, Taxi from the Ramlas will be around 7-8 euro. Taxi from the airport for 2 adults, 1 kid and 2 suitcases will be around 30 euro, depend on the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Big room”
Reviews.Author: Chicago71
Reviews.Content: There are at least a couple of Catalonia Hotels in Barcelona. This review is about the one on Calle Muntaner. We found this hotel on Barcelona30.com and decided to book it to save some money even though it was not in Eixample, the area where we wanted to stay. I guess it is a little cheaper because it is not in a prime location. We were surprised that our room was very large and the bathroom had both a tub and a separate shower. There was a drainage problem with the shower but it was taken care of right away. The staff was courteous and helpful. Most guests we encountered were American or British. The hotel is located in an upscale residential neighborhood that reminded me a bit of Beverly Hills. It's a lot quieter than being near the hustle and bustle of central Barcelona, but it took only 4 or 5 metro stops to get to Catalunya. The El Puxtet stop is a few blocks away. On a couple of occasions, we needed to get to the hotel from Eixample or Old Town after the metro closed for the night and the cab ride cost roughly 10 euros. There is a very good café (Toscana Café) kitty corner from the hotel. We went there every day for brunch and coffee before heading to the metro because prices were reasonable and the food was very good. We didn't try the hotel restaurant which had a breakfast buffet that didn't look so great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cancnt
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness is super for this hotel ! However location is nearly Park Güell :) However metro station El Putxet is only 200 metres . Thanks for everything HOTEL CATALONIA SUITE !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HUGHESY13
Reviews.Content: The Hotel entrance was very welcoming clean and modern. It took awhile to check in though and there was no friendlyness by the receptionist - also no information was given to us about the hotel for example breakfast times or directions to the room Once we have located our room it was very clean and up to date - we had no views though !! The bathroom was fab walk in shower and Jacuzzi bath also great that they provided towels and some toiletries. The rooms were also serviced every day to a very high standard Breakfast was very good there was enough there for everyones tastes. It was in the basement of the hotel. It was very clean and the buffet was kept refreshed the staff were very attentive and always cleared your table once you had finished. The Hotel was a bit outside of the hustle and Bustle of Barcelona . The Hotel gave us a map of the area so we could locate the underground station which was only a 5 minute walk to and we found it very safe to walk through after dark. It was only a 10 minute underground ride to the centre of the City. Getting a underground ticket was easy to as the machines could be translated to English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: QUEENOFEUROPE
Reviews.Content: Well situated close to underground links to the city centre but far enough away to avoid the crowds and noise, the hotel is perfect for travellers of all ages. The hotel is modern, clean and the staff were welcoming and polite. They were always available to answer questions and went out of their way to provide local advice even drawing locations and directions on maps. The breakfast room in the basement is bright and the choice of food superb with fresh coffee and and vast array of fresh fruit, meats and cheeses alongside more traditional breakfast items. My room was clean, modern and well equipped as well as having the much talked about whirlpool bath and walk in shower. I would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1travel5MV
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Catalonia Suite is a very nice 4 star hotel in Barcelona. The rooms are modern and new with comfy beds and nice marble and granite bathrooms. The only bad part of our rooms was that the windows opened not to the outside, but to an interior courtyard that was designated for smokers. The hotel is two blocks from a metro station that will take you to the center of the city and the major plazas. It is in a quite more residential neighborhood where the apartments sell for very high prices. I did not like that the TV was broken, but I didn't have time to use it anyhow and the staff was indifferent. They were fairly rude in helping me find a camera memory card I left in the hotel after my departure and said it disappeared.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: AdrianBelfast
Reviews.Content: All in all this is a great hotel. It is incredibly clean and the rooms are huge with the whirlpool jet bath and separate shower room being top quality. The front desk staff were able to sort out my complicated booking without any problems, although when the air con failed in the room the language barrier seemed to prevent them understanding the problem. Breakfasts are excellent, but if you get the chance check out the "Toscana" diner across the road. There's also a handy corner shop on route to the train station (5 mins walk away) for any small essentials you need.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aga2000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed In Catalonia Suite Hotel for a couple of nights in October. It was enjoyable but I am not sure I would rate this hotel as 4 star, it just lacked this extra something. Don't get me wrong everything was fine, clean but jut not outstanding. I found service a bit abrupt, smile does not cost antyhing! On the postitve side - breakfast buffet was very good and the bathrooms are very well equipped. Location is ok although not central - very easy to get around on metro. The closest station is app 7min walk.
